text.0: burn him not up nor quite consume him agni let not his body or his skin be scattered.
text.1: o jātavedas when thou hast matured him then send him on his way unto the fathers.
text.2: when thou hast made him ready jātavedas then do thou give him over to the fathers.
text.3: when he attains unto the life that waits him he shall become the deities controller.
text.4: the sun receive thine eye tne wind thy spirit go as thy merit is to earth or heaven.
text.5: go if it be thy lot unto the waters go make thine home in plants with all thy members.
text.6: thy portion is the goat with heat consume him let thy fierce flame thy glowing splendour burn him.
text.7: with thine auspicious forms o jātavedas bear this man to the region of the pious.
text.8: again o agni to the fathers send him who offered in thee goes with our oblations.
text.9: wearing new life let him increase his offspring let him rejoin a body jātavedas.
text.10: what wound soeer the dark bird hath inflicted the emmet or the serpent or the jackal.
text.11: may agni who devoureth all things heal it and soma who hath passed into the brahmans.
text.12: shield thee with flesh against the flames of agni encompass thee about with fat and marrow.
text.13: so will the bold one eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.
text.14: forbear o agni to upset this ladle the gods and they who merit soma love it.
text.15: this ladle this which serves the gods to drink from in this the immortal deities rejoice them.
text.16: send afar flesh eating agni bearing off stains may he depart to yamas subjects.
text.17: but let this other jātavedas carry oblation to the gods for he is skilful.
text.18: i choose as god for fatherworship agni flesheater who hath past within your dwelling.
text.19: while looking on this other jātavedas let him light flames in the supreme assembly.
text.20: with offerings meet let agni bring the fathers who support the law.
text.21: let him announce oblations paid to fathers and to deities.
text.22: right gladly would we set thee down right gladly make thee burn and glow.
text.23: gladly bring yearning fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice.
text.24: cool agni and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt.
text.25: here let the waterlily grow and tender grass and leafy herb.
text.26: o full of coolness thou cool plant full of fresh moisture freshening herb.
text.27: come hither with the female frog fill with delight this agni here.
